docs.snippet: The Yankees are hoping Masahiro Tanaka, who they signed for $155 million, can match the results of Yu Darvish, who has starred in two seasons in Texas....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees are hoping Masahiro Tanaka, who they signed for $155 million, can match the results of Yu Darvish, who has starred in two seasons in Texas.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that New York Yankees are hoping pitcher Masahiro Tanaka can match results of Yu Darvish, who has starred in two seasons with Texas Rangers.

headline.main: Rangers’ Darvish a Model of Success for Tanaka
headline.print_headline: Darvish Has Set a High Bar for Tanaka

docs.snippet: Runners may not deviate from their path to score in order to initiate contact, but catchers who block their progress or stand in their way to field a throw are still open to a hit....
docs.lead_paragraph: Runners may not deviate from their path to score in order to initiate contact, but catchers who block their progress or stand in their way to field a throw are still open to a hit.
docs.abstract: Major League Baseball and its players adopt rule limiting home plate collisions, rather than banning them outright; in what both sides say is a one-year experiment, rule allows collisions if the catcher has the ball and is blocking the runner’s direct path to home plate, or if the catcher goes into the basepath to field a throw to the plate.

headline.main: New M.L.B. Rule Aims to Cut Down on Collisions at the Plate
headline.print_headline: M.L.B. Rule Aims to Limit Collisions at the Plate

docs.snippet: Rafael Montero, who will start the Mets’ first exhibition game Friday, has earned praise for his excellent mechanics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rafael Montero, who will start the Mets’ first exhibition game Friday, has earned praise for his excellent mechanics.
docs.abstract: New York Mets young pitcher Rafael Montero, who has earned praise for his mechanics and his command, will start Mets exhibition opener; other Mets items noted.

headline.main: Young Mets Pitcher Is Quietly on the Rise
headline.print_headline: Young Mets Pitcher Is Quietly on the Rise

docs.snippet: The new director of the M.L.B. players union said that “the page has been turned” on Alex Rodriguez’s short-lived lawsuit that implicated the union and a respected former director....
docs.lead_paragraph: The new director of the M.L.B. players union said that “the page has been turned” on Alex Rodriguez’s short-lived lawsuit that implicated the union and a respected former director.
docs.abstract: Tony Clark, now the executive director of the Major League Baseball Players Assn, says New York Yankees slugger Alex Rodriguez is still member of union despite short-lived lawsuit that implicated the union and a respected former director.

headline.main: Rodriguez Still Belongs to Union Despite Lawsuit Rancor, Director Says
headline.print_headline: Rodriguez Still Belongs to Union Despite Lawsuit Rancor, Director Says

docs.snippet: A controversial plan to build a minor league baseball stadium near the historic site of a slave marketplace and burial ground in Virginia's capital cleared another hurdle on Monday night as the Richmond City Council gave the project tentative supp...
docs.lead_paragraph: A controversial plan to build a minor league baseball stadium near the historic site of a slave marketplace and burial ground in Virginia's capital cleared another hurdle on Monday night as the Richmond City Council gave the project tentative support.

headline.main: Plan for Ballpark Near Historic Virginia Slave Market Site Advances

docs.snippet: San Francisco Giants catcher Buster Posey, whose 2011 season was cut short after the Marlins' Scott Cousins crashed into him at the plate, said Tuesday that a home plate collision rule adopted by Major League Baseball and its players does a good t...
docs.lead_paragraph: San Francisco Giants catcher Buster Posey, whose 2011 season was cut short after the Marlins' Scott Cousins crashed into him at the plate, said Tuesday that a home plate collision rule adopted by Major League Baseball and its players does a good thing by eliminating "malicious collisions."

docs.snippet: A federal judge says she is unconvinced of similarities between the movie’s script and one that was written by the lawsuit’s plaintiff....
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge says she is unconvinced of similarities between the movie’s script and one that was written by the lawsuit’s plaintiff.
docs.abstract: Federal Judge Dale S Fischer expects to grant summary judgement against producer Ryan Brooks, who accused Warner Bros of basing Clint Eastwood baseball film Trouble With the Curve on script that belonged to him.

headline.main: Judge Likely to Dismiss Script Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Is Likely to Dismiss ‘Trouble With the Curve’ Case

docs.snippet: Joe Torre says Major League Baseball's playing rules committee leaned toward banning all home plate collisions but concluded it would be unrealistic because contact between catchers and baserunners is sometimes unavoidable....
docs.lead_paragraph: Joe Torre says Major League Baseball's playing rules committee leaned toward banning all home plate collisions but concluded it would be unrealistic because contact between catchers and baserunners is sometimes unavoidable.

headline.main: Torre: Banning Home Plate Collisions Not Realistic
headline.print_headline: Torre: Banning Home Plate Collisions Not Realistic
